Class GuiController

java.lang.Object
com.comp2042.controllers.GuiController
All Implemented Interfaces:
javafx.fxml.Initializable
public class GuiController extends Object implements javafx.fxml.Initializable
This controller manages all graphical user interface (GUI) operations for the gameplay display in the Tetris-style game.

It is responsible for initializing, rendering, and updating all visual elements of the game, including:

  • The main game board (grid and current falling brick)
  • The ghost piece showing where the current brick will land
  • The next brick preview and held brick panel
  • Score, level, and total cleared lines labels
  • Pause menu and game-over menu overlays
  • Keyboard shortcuts and keybinding display

The class uses InputEventListener to forward user input events to the game logic and Timer to control the in-game timing of brick drops. Mouse interactions trigger sound effects via Sfx and may also open the settings menu through SettingsController.

The GUI components are defined in the FXML layout file referenced by gameLayout.fxml, which should be linked to this controller using fx:controller.

The controller handles both "soft drop" and "hard drop" actions, updates the display matrices for the current brick, next brick, and hold brick, and ensures all updates respect the game's paused or game-over state.

This class is uses ViewData to stores the position and color information for bricks, and SaveData to get user keybindings and toggle preferences.

  • Constructor Details

    • GuiController

      public GuiController()

  • Method Details

    • initialize

      public void initialize(URL location, ResourceBundle resources)
      Initializes the GUI components and sets up keyboard and mouse events.
      • Sets up keyboard controls using SaveData to retrieve the user's custom key bindings, and SaveDataType to determine which actions to trigger.
      • Sets up mouse events with sound effects using Sfx.
      • Starts the in-game timer.
      Specified by:
      initialize in interface javafx.fxml.Initializable
      Parameters:
      location - the location used to resolve relative paths
      resources - the resources used to localize the root object

    • initGameView

      public void initGameView(int[][] boardMatrix, ViewData brick)
      Initializes the game view including background grid, current brick, ghost piece, next brick display, and hold brick display.
      Parameters:
      boardMatrix - the current game board matrix
      brick - the current brick and its associated view data

    • refreshNextBrick

      public void refreshNextBrick(ViewData brick)
      Refreshes the display of the next piece.

      This method updates the next piece's display matrix based on ViewData.getNextBrickData(), using the GridPane defined in the FXML layout with setRectangleData. The layout position (x and y coordinates) remains unchanged.

      Parameters:
      brick - the ViewData representing the current brick's data

    • refreshHoldBrick

      public void refreshHoldBrick(ViewData brick)
      Refreshes the display of the hold piece.

      This method displays the hold piece's display with the ViewData.getHoldBrickData(), using the GridPane defined in the FXML layout with setRectangleData. The layout position (x and y coordinates) remains unchanged.

      Parameters:
      brick - the ViewData representing the current brick's data

    • resetHoldBrickDisplay

      public void resetHoldBrickDisplay()
      Refreshes the hold-piece display by rendering an empty grid.

      This method resets the visual display of the held panel by replacing the current display matrix with a transparent grid using setRectangleData. The layout position (x and y coordinates) remains unchanged.

    • refreshGameBackground

      public void refreshGameBackground(int[][] board)
      Refreshes the game background display based on the current board state.

      This method iterates through the board matrix and updates each corresponding brick data in the display matrix using setRectangleData.

      Parameters:
      board - the matrix of the current board state

    • gameOver

      public void gameOver()
      Displays the game-over screen and stops all gameplay activity.

      This method stops the timeline, shows the game-over menu, updates the game-over state flag and stops Timer.

    • bindScore

      public void bindScore(javafx.beans.property.IntegerProperty integerProperty)
      Binds the score label to an integer property so that it automatically updates whenever the score changes.vcrcrrv
      Parameters:
      integerProperty - the IntegerProperty representing the current score

    • bindTotalClearedLines

      public void bindTotalClearedLines(javafx.beans.property.IntegerProperty integerProperty)
      Binds the total cleared lines label to an integer property so that it automatically updates whenever the total lines cleared changes.
      Parameters:
      integerProperty - the IntegerProperty representing the number of lines cleared

    • bindLevel

      public void bindLevel(javafx.beans.property.IntegerProperty integerProperty)
      Binds the level label to an integer property so that it automatically updates whenever the level changes.
      Parameters:
      integerProperty - the IntegerProperty representing the current level

    • updateKeyLabels

      public void updateKeyLabels()
      Sets the label text to inform the user of the current control shortcuts.

      Retrieves the user's custom key bindings using SaveData and determines which keys to display using SaveDataType.

    • setSpeed

      public void setSpeed(int speed)
      Sets the drop speed for the falling bricks.

      This method redefines the timeline whenever the speed needs to be changed. A shorter timeline interval results in faster falling blocks.

      Parameters:
      speed - the drop interval in milliseconds

    • setEventListener

      public void setEventListener(InputEventListener eventListener)
      Sets the InputEventListener to communicate user input events to game logic.
      Parameters:
      eventListener - the listener handling input events
